definition:
After a period in which the #Agent has been working on a #Goal, the #Agent manages to attain it.  The #Goal may be a desired state, or be conceptualized as an event.
<ex></ex>
<ex>[Jeremey|Agent] [obediently|Manner] [accomplished|Target] [this task|Goal].</ex>

<ex>In response, the Prime Minister has simply cited [his|Agent] [free-market|Domain] [[accomplishments|Goal]|Target]. </ex>

A Speaker starts a communicative interaction by referring to the #Addressees. The choice of the form of #Address characterizes their social relation. Addressing at the text opening serves to establish contact and thus contributes to structuring the interaction.
This frame is limited by the position of its instantiations in the text: unlike the frame Address_focus_addressee [so far defined only for German: Anrede_Fokus_Adressat], it occurs exclusively at the beginning of an interaction.
The frame #Appellations describes the use of names and titles for addressing people.
Age_descriptor

The absolute #Value of a quantifiable #Attribute  of an item is determined by adding up the values for the #Attribute of the individuals or parts that make up the item. The item is not expressed as a separate constituent but it is presupposed by the concept of #Attribute.  Alternatively, the #Numbers form an implicit set whose sum is the #Value associated with the set.   In some cases what is reported is just the cardinality of the individuals that make up the item so that in effect the #Value is a count. In other cases the identity of the #Attribute can only be inferred from the #Value.

There is no cognizer on the scene in this frame. Instead, the frame focuses on the relationship between the #Attribute or #Numbers and the #Value, which is stable and unchanging regardless of who performs  the calculation.

<ex>Defence is provided in West Germany by [armed forces whose number|Attribute] [totals|Target] [close to half a million men and women|Value] </ex> .
<ex> [Revenues|Attribute] [totalled|Target] [568.86m pounds|Value] </ex>
<ex>The WHO estimated that the cumulative [total|Target] [of AIDS cases|Attribute] was [more than 1,500,000|Value]. </ex>

An #Asset, the safety of which is desirable, is protected from damage by a covering, the #Armor. The #Armor covers part or all of the #Asset and is designed to absorb force from an oncoming #Danger.

<ex>They were wearing nothing but primitive [wooden|mat] [[armor|Armor]|Target].</ex>

<ex>An extra level of safety is provided by [the soldiers'|Asset] [ballistic|Danger] [[armor|Armor]|Target].</ex>

This frame contains LUs that express the #Form which a piece of #Artwork represents. The #Form may also represent the entire body  of an #Artist's work. The #Form may be further characterized by the #Time of some #Artwork's creation or other #Descriptors.

<ex>[Her|Artist] [[style|Target]|Form] [of painting|Artwork] is an excellent blend of traditional and modern.</ex>
<ex>The [whimsical|Descriptor] [[style|Target]|Form] [of this piece|Artwork] is very effective.</ex>

This frame covers terms used to get someone's attention, including #Interjections (e.g. <ment>hey</ment>, <ment>yo</ment>) and certain terms of address (#Address_term), the latter of which may serve the function of attention getting.

<ex>[[Hey|Target]|Interj].</ex>
<ex>[Hey|Interj], [boy|Add_t].</ex>
<ex>[Hey|Interj], [boy|Add_t], come over here now!</ex>

A #Proposition is attributed to a #Speaker or a #Text.

<ex>[According|Target] [to|Target] [the Press Trust of India|spe] [in an article published on its Web site Thursday|tex], [the woman has been identified as 31-year-old Aafia Siddiqui, who was being sought by U.S. officials last week along with two other men, including one whose last known address was in Miramar, Fla|pro].</ex>

<ex> In addition, [according|Target] [to|Target] [Section I3.5b|tex], [the spacing of stud shear connectors along the length of a supporting beam shall not exceed 36?|pro]. </ex>

<ex>[According|Target] [to|Target] [the Pope|spe], [Muslims believe in the same God|pro] and according to Jesus, Muslims are the greatest in Heaven.</ex>
A Cognizer has a piece of Content in their model of the world due to deduction, inference, or similar means of arriving at information from perceivables.

Some #Content is part of the mental model of a #Cognizer. The #Cognizer arrives at the mental model not by direct perception but by reasoning from perceived phenomena. Alternatively, the #Role of a particular object is known to be applicable to that object.

<ex>[That fact|con] is [known|Target] [to many|cog].</ex>

<ex>The [presumed|Target] [killer|rol] was last seen driving south on the interstate.</ex>

A piece of information about a #Landmark is presented as more accessible and useful for determining or communicating a similar type of information about the #Trajector.  In this construal of a situation, there is a (more) profiled element, the #Trajector, and an un- or less profiled element, the #Landmark.  In combination with a schematically-defined #Profiled_region (with a pre-defined relationship to the #Landmark), the #Landmark serves as the basis for understanding the status or location of the #Trajector.

<ex>[The cat|Trajector] [in|Target] [the shed|Landmark] purred violently .</ex>
<ex>[The shed|Trajector] [around|Target] [the cat|Landmark] shook .</ex>
<ex>We 'll have to [leave|Trajector] [before|Target] [noon|Landmark] .</ex>
<ex>In the 1990s , though , [the rate at which DNA could be read|Trajector] revved [into|Target] [high gear|Landmark] .</ex>

A #Winner has victory over an #Loser.

<ex>[He|Winner] [always|Frequency] [beats|Target] [me|Loser] [at chess|Competition].</ex>

In this frame a #Speaker ceases speaking, sometimes about a particular #Topic. An #Expressor may also be indicated.
<ex></ex>
The words of this frame are very frequently used imperatively, to the extent that certain words and phrases (<ment>not another word, silence, shhh</ment>) can only be used this way.

<ex>Finally, [Jan|Speaker] [shut|Target] [up|Target] [about his car accident|Topic].</ex>
<ex>[The children's laughter|Expressor] [quieted|Target] [down|Target].</ex>
<ex>Somehow, [he|Speaker] managed to [hold|Target] [his|Speaker] [tongue|Target].</ex>

#Artists work at various tasks that further the completion of a film, play, television show, or other similar #Production.  #Artists never appear on stage or in front of a camera.  Some (e.g., a director) may interact with the actors (on-screen participants) of the #Production.  Often times a particular #Production is made for distribution by a #Distributor, by a particular #Studio, or in a specific #Medium.  The #Artists may be categorized into #Type or work in specific #Medium.
<ex>[Steven Spielberg|Artist] [directed|Target] [several films|Production] [for Universal Pictures|Studio].</ex>
<ex>[Universal Pictures and Amblin Entertainment|Studio] [produced|Target] [Jurassic Park|Production] [for MCA|Distributor].</ex>
<ex>Surprisingly, this [film|Medium] [[producer|Target]|Artist] was willing to work for a cable company.</ex>
<ex>[Independent|Type] [[producers|Target]|Artist] often win big at smaller film festivals.</ex>

This frame concerns entities conventionally being referred to by particular names.

<ex>[Her|Entity] [name|Target] <m>was</m> [Lola|Name].</ex>

In this frame, an #Entity or #Behavior is suspicious or otherwise subject to question.  The general implication is that the #Entity or #Behavior provides evidence for some (as yet unproven) socially undesirable conclusion about a (usually implicit) #Social_actor.  (Such conclusions often include the idea that some individual is lying, or that a crime was committed.)
<ex>We found some [suspicious|Target] [checks|Entity] lying on his desk.</ex>
<ex>It <m>was</m> rather [suspicious|Target] [of you|soc] [to leave the party just before the police arrived|Behavior].</ex>

Compared to its #Competitors, a #Standard is at the high end of a scale with respect to some #Variable. The #Competitors are frequently not realized syntactically.
<ex>The taxpayer is supporting [a system|Standard] [unmatched|Target] [in wastefulness |Variable].</ex>
<ex>The drawing room was a place of [unmatched|Target] [squalor|Variable].</ex>
<ex> She was envious of her mother's [matchless|Target] [beauty|Variable].</ex>

<ex></ex>When there is no overt #Variable it must be understood from the context. <ex>[He|Standard] was [unmatched|Target]  [ by any other  politician of his time|Competitors].</ex>

<ex></ex>When the target occurs as the modifier of a predicate nominal, it  is tagged as #Standard, rather than #Variable.
 <ex>They were [matchless|Target] [needlers of each other|Standard].</ex>

A #Target_symbol in a #Target_representation  system is presented as equivalent to a #Source_symbol in a #Source_representation system in the ability to express a particular #Content.

<ex>[The term employment area|Target_symbol] [translates|Target] [the French zone d'emploi|Source_symbol].</ex>
<ex>The term employment area [translates|Target] [the French|Source_representation] zone d'emploi.</ex>

<ex>[The term|Target_symbol] [translates|Target] [the Russian raznorechie (literally ""different-speech-ness"")|Source_symbol].</ex>
<ex>The term [translates|Target] the [Russian|Source_representation] raznorechie (literally ""different-speech-ness"".</ex>

A #Billing_authority communicates in written form that the #Debtor owes the #Owed_party (often the same as the #Billing_authority) some amount of #Money for certain #Goods (including services) provided by the #Owed_party or to clear a debt for a #Bad_action by the #Debtor against the #Owed_party.

A trigger mechanism brings about a change in a biological system.

<ex>[The reflex|Trigger] [increases|Target] [cardiac output|Systemic_effect].</ex>

A #Traveller boards a #Vehicle that they intend to use as a means of transportation either as a passenger or as a driver.

<ex>On the 5th of December, 1834, [we|tra] [embarked|Target] [on board the merchant ship Hellespont|Vehicle].</ex>

<ex>[She|Traveller] [boarded|Target] [the train|Vehicle] [ahead of him|Time].</ex>

<ex>[On 19 September|Time] [the battalion|Traveller] [embussed|Target] and headed southward into the Swordfish training area some 40 miles away.</ex>

This frame contains words for motions or actions an #Agent performs using some part of his/her body. Most words that evoke this frame have a specific motion of a specific #Body_part associated with them, but a few are more general (e.g. <m>move.v</m>).

A number of words in this frame occur as blends with Communication, in which the action has an #Addressee.  For example,

<ex>Pat [nodded|Target] [at Kim|Addressee].</ex>

These examples differ from Communication.Gesture in that no specific message need be expressed, as in
<ex>She [nodded|Target] to him to sit down.</ex>

Since this frame involves a particular type of motion, it contains the frame elements #Source, #Path, #Goal and #Area, which originate in the motion frame.  All of these frame elements are generally expressed in PP Complements.
<ex>The boy [swung|Target] his legs [from under the table|Source].</ex>

This frame covers words for #Body_parts belonging to a #Possessor, which may be characterized by a #Descriptor. The location of the #Body_partmay be identified in terms of  its #Attachment or its #Orientational_location.  A #Subregion of a #Body_part may also be indicated.
<ex></ex>
<ex>He had to brace [his|Possessor] [right|Orientational_location] [[arm|Body_part]|Target] against his leg in order to fight the roll.</ex>

<ex>The dog measured [its|Possessor] [blond|Descriptor] [[belly|Body_part]|Target] in the mud.</ex>

<ex></ex>

A #Financial_instrument (a bond or insurance) fulfills a condition at a certain #Time after which the #Issuer of the #Financial_instrument is legally obligated to pay the #Holder a monetary #Value, based on the instrument's original #Principle and the #Interest rate.

<ex>[The bond|Financial_instrument] had [matured|Target] [to its full value|Value] [at 30 years|].</ex>

This is an abstract frame for events which allows annotation of verbal targets according to the reduced, general set of frame elements proposed by the Boulder group.
<ex>[Belli 's clients|Eq1] have [included|Target] [Jack Ruby ... and Jim and Tammy Baker|Eq2].</ex>

This frame contains words that describe a #Boundary between two #Entities.  In many cases, the #Boundary is the border between an #Entity and some unnamed space, generally conceived of as empty.

<ex>[The canyon|Boundary] is the [border|Target] [between the two states|Entities].</ex>

An #Agent causes #Air to move in a direction, usually specifying either in or out of the body.

<ex>[Lee|Agent] [breathed|Target] [the hot desert air|Air].</ex>

This frame concerns the movement of a #Theme and an #Agent and/or #Carrier.   The #Agent, a person or other sentient entity, controls the shared #Path by moving the #Theme during the motion. In other words, the #Agent has overall motion in directing the motion of the #Theme.  The #Carrier may be a separate entity, or it may be the #Agent's body. The #Constant_location may be a subregion of the #Agent's body or (a subregion of) a vehicle that the #Agent uses.

<ex>[Karl|Agent] [carried|Target] [the books|Theme] [across campus|Path] [to the library|goa] [on his head|CL].</ex>
<ex>[Karl|Agent] [carried|Target] [the books|Theme] [across campus|Path] [to the library|goa] [in his truck|CL].</ex>
<ex>[Karl|Agent] [carried|Target] [the books|Theme] [across campus|Path] [to the library|goa] [by truck|Carrier].</ex>
<ex>[The truck|Carrier] [carried|Target] [the books|Theme] [across campus|Path] [to the library|goa] [in specially designed boxes|CL].</ex>
The  FEs include #Path, #Goal, and #Source.  #Area is an area that contains the motion when the path is understood as irregular.
This frame emphasizes the path of movement as opposed to the FEs Source or Goal as in Filling or Placing.

An #Agent performs an #Action incorrectly, resulting in some undesirable result or, at best, achieving some part of the desired result but not in a desirable way.  The affected #Patient may be mentioned metonymically for the #Action.  In place of both of these, a #Topic can describe some general field in which an #Agent makes an error or errors.

<ex>[Mickey|Agent] [botched|Target] [that swing|Action].</ex>
<ex>[Julia|Agent] [bungled|Target] [the cake|Patient].</ex>

This frame contains adjectives and nouns that describe the truth or sincerity of communication. These words, analogously to behaver-evaluating words, can apply either to #Speakers or to the #Messages they produce. They can occur with <ment>about</ment>-PPs expressing #Topic.

<ex>[Evelyn|Speaker] was [candid|Target] [with me|Addressee] [about the party|Topic].</ex>

This frame concerns #Stock, a purchasable and sellable asset representing a #Shareholder's share in a company (the #Issuer). #Stock entitles the #Shareholder to profits of the #Issuer company, as determined by the governing board of the #Issuer company. LUs in this frame can denote the type of capital stock investment into a business (common or preferred) or the investment itself.  Common stock is also known as ordinary stock or voting stock.

<ex>[My|Shareholder] [ten|amt] [preferred|Type] [[shares|Target]|Stock] [in Google|Issuer] are worth more than your ten common shares in Apple.</ex>

This frame presents a situation where there is a certain #Number of instances of an #Entity or a certain #Number that quantifies a #Unit. Numbers are used to count any kind of #Entity that has distinct individuals, or alternatively, to count #Units whose own function is to quantify some property, with the #Number associated with each word of this frame differentiating groups, individuals, parts of individual #Entitys of different sizes, or to differentiate the quantity of the #Units. A countable #Entity prototypically occupies its own space separately from other instances of the #Entity, and each instance of the #Entity has specific kinds of parts or substance or characteristics as specified by the kind of #Entity it is described as.   #Units (e.g., hours, inches, dozens) have the function of quantifying some property and as a result, naturally occur with a #Number to say how the current property compares to the standard quantification of the #Unit.  Less prototypical numbers, which occur much more frequently with #Units rather than #Entitys, describe situations with less than a whole #Unitor #Entity (half.n), or the lack of a #Unit or #Entity (zero.num).
<ex></ex>
There is also a #Precision associated with the #Number. In most cases, there is a certain amount of imprecision in the #Number that is assumed, especially for so-called ""round"" numbers like twenty.num or hundred.num, and for the class of approximate numbers, like couple.n; for other numbers, e.g. two.num, the expected precision is very high. Separately from this inherent possibility of precision or imprecision, numbers may be modified by an explicit specification of their #Precision, with phrases like ""about"", etc.

<ex>Only [[two|Target]|Number] [senators|Entity] voted in support of the president .</ex>
<ex>Dr. Malik has confined [almost|Precision] a [[score|Target]|Num] [of such unfortunates|Entity] in his basement, you know.</ex>
<ex>We endured [[forty|Target]|Number] [days of snow|Entity] .</ex>
<ex>There were [[thirty|Num]|Target] [of the little blue creatures|Entity] staring up at him.</ex>
<ex>She had only two pieces of Halloween candy left, but I still had [[ten|Target]|Number]! [DNI|Entity]</ex>
<ex>The ship was [[three|Target]|Number] [degrees|Unit] off course .</ex>

<ex></ex>
This frame includes extrathematic FEs for a set of non-lexical constructions that put together quantifying expressions.  Firstly, a #Number may itself be quantified by having a certain #Multiplier, e.g. ""three hundred"".  Secondly, a sequence of numerical expressions may be strung together, with or without ""and"", to produce a #Composite_number representing a #Number that is the sum of the constituent numbers and that collectively modifies the #Entity or #Unit.

<ex>Stephen has more than [five|mul] [[hundred|Number]|Target] in his closet! [DNI|Entity]</ex>
<ex></ex>
<ex></ex>
As can be seen in the first of the next two examples, when the target is a number in front of another number in the function of a #Multiplier, we consider the number it is modifying to be a #Unit:

<ex>There are just over [[six|Target]|Number] [billion|Unit] people in the world today.</ex>
<ex>There are [just over|deg] [six|Multiplier] [[billion|Num]|Target] [people|Entity] in the world today.</ex>

The relationship between numbers, as lexical units in this frame, and the broader category of numbers is a complex one.  In particular, there is a semiotic system that arranges the tiny set of numeral symbols (0, 1, 2 ... 9), with some additional symbols (commas, decimal points, fraction lines, scientific notation of exponents) to generate a standard representation for numbers that, while not universal, is at least language independent.  Our description of numbers is focused on the English system of numbers, as would occur in the spoken language or in pronunciations (actually decodings) of written numerals in English.  Since numerals are well-understood by virtually all speakers of most languages, and are well-processed by computers, we do not view the description of these structures in FrameNet as necessary.  As a convenience, we include numerals as wordforms when they coincide with a basic number word of English (e.g., ""3"" is a wordform of three.num).
<ex></ex>
Of more interest for the FrameNet Project is the large number of idiosyncrasies in the constructions that use numbers, very few of which will be well-exemplified in our annotation.  These include indications of range (from ... to), approximation (in the neighborhood of), and descriptions of group properties (""A whopping [three|Target] singers showed up"")

<ex></ex>

Technical note: The frame as currently devised does not distinguish between ""six apples"" and ""six of the apples"".  It is clear that in the first case, we are talking about six entities that fit whatever properties apples have.  In the second case, however, there is a specific set of apples that was already under discussion, and the six apples are members of this set.  There is a way of understanding this second case in terms of the first, namely, that ""six of the apples"" is interpreted as six entities with the property of being members of the given set of apples.  Since understanding the second case involves an additional notion of set membership, this could be indicated with a different FE than any we currently have in this frame, perhaps *Set, which is in an exclusion relation with Entity.  However, the major semantic distinction between these two types of #Entity is whether there is a definite set, and this distinction is independently indicated by the definite article in examples like ""six of the apples"".

A Distributor sells, lends, or otherwise distributes a class of Goods. In the prototypical case, the Distributor is a retailer who generally keeps some type of Goods on site for the purpose of selling it to a buyer. Extensions include lending Goods (e.g., libraries, movie rental outlets), organization-internal distribution (as in a hospital), or other non-commercial distribution centers. The Goods are constrained to be a type of item (e.g., <ment>canned goods</ment>, <ment>antique dressers</ment>) rather than a particular or unique item (e.g., <ment>Smith's last self-portrait</ment>, <ment>that guitar I saw here last week</ment>). Note that a Distributor may <ment>carry</ment> some particular goods, but may not have it <ment>on hand</ment> at that exact moment.

<ex>[Trader Joe's|Distributor] [carries|Target] [a wide variety of foods, drinks, and househole necessities|Goods].</ex>

The words in this frame involve an #Undesirable_event which affects the #Patient negatively.  No agent need be involved. <ex></ex> <ex>The first [calamity|Target] <m>was</m> [a disastrous trade war with Holland|Undesirable_event].</ex>  <ex>It is sad to have to make a living by grubbing around in the dirt of a [national|Patient] [[calamity|Undesirable_event]|Target].</ex>  <ex>[The result|Undesirable_event] has been [catastrophic|Target].</ex>

A #Cognizer construes an #Item as belonging to a certain #Category.  In this process, the #Cognizer may either passively perceive the #Item and note that it fits the #Criteria for a #Category, or, alternatively, actively examine the #Item for certain #Criteria that define a #Category (or set of #Categorys).

Most members of the frame can also describe a resulting cognitive state of the #Cognizer with respect to the #Item and #Category which no longer requires the current perception or consideration of the #Item.  A few LUs (e.g. <ment>peg.v, pigeonhole.v</ment>) do not readily allow stative interpretation, and a few LUs (e.g. <ment>deem.v, regard.v</ment>) only allow stative interpretation.

<ex>[You|Cognizer] 've already [stereotyped|Target] [me|Item] [as a bimbo|Category], have n't you?</ex>

A #Beneficial_situation causes an improvement in a #Benefitted_situation.  In many cases, a #Beneficiary (an individual postively affected by the #Benefitted_situation) is mentioned instead of or in addition to the #Benefitted_situation.  In some cases, a #Benefactor brings about the #Beneficial_situation and is mentioned in its place. Some lexical units of this frame are marked with the semantic type ""Negative"", indicating a disimprovement of the #Benefitted_situation.
<ex></ex>

<ex>[These tax cuts|Beneficial_situation] [benefit|Target] [the poor|Beneficiary] .</ex>
<ex>[The Chinese group|Benefactor] probably [benefitted|Target] [us|Beneficiary] [with their quick action|Means] [more than the other way round|Degree] .</ex>
<ex>[Most petrochemicals|Beneficial_situation] are [detrimental|Target] [to human health|Benefitted_situation] .</ex>

In many cases, a #Beneficial_situation FE also contains a mention of a #Benefactor, in which case we use dual FE-layer annotation to indicate both FEs:

<ex>[The foundation's 50m donation|Beneficial_situation] [benefits|Target] [the country's educational system|Beneficiary] [immensely|Degree].</ex>
<ex>[The foundation's|Benefactor]</ex>

<ex>[His presence|Beneficial_situation] at the summit was [massively|Degree] [detrimental|Target] [to diplomatic relations|Beneficiary] .</ex>
<ex>[His|Benefactor]</ex>


<ex></ex>


Unlike in Commerce_scenario, the recipient is not presented as paying for the good or service that they receive.
<ex></ex>
Targets from the Cause_harm frame (e.g., injure.v) and from the Damaging frame (e.g. damage.n) are very frequently used metaphorically to indicate the opposite of the Conferring_benefit frame.  These should be annotated in the Cause_harm and Damaging frames and marked with the Metaphor sentence tag.

A #Cause event brings about and potentially maintains the burning of #Flammables.  Often, an #Agent stands in for the intentional action the brings about the fire, or an Actor stands in for the action that brings about the fire unintentionally.

A #Theme that is in motion assumes a new #Direction in which it moves.


<ex>[We|Thm] took our chances and [turned|Target] [right|dir] [by a petrol station|Place] and, bingo, there she was--Fir Park.</ex>

<ex>Molly followed silently as [Desmond|Thm] left the large paneled hall and [turned|Target] [right|Direction] [through a swing door|Path] [into a long, bare corridor|Goal].</ex>

<ex>Cross O'Connell Bridge and continue along D'Olier Street, <m>make</m> a [right|Direction] [turn|Target] [onto College Street|Goal]. [CNI|Theme]</ex>

<ex>Go past the unattended guardhouse, and <m>take</m> a [sharp|ang] [left|Direction] [turn|Target] [down the ramp|Path]. [CNI|Theme]</ex>

<ex>Take the elevator to the sixth floor and <m>make</m> [two|Frequency] [[lefts|dir]|Target]. [CNI|Thm]</ex>

This frame describes a general situation in which an #Owner either increases or decreases their amount of a #Possession.  The increase or decrease may either be physical or metaphorical.
<ex>[The plant|Owner] [lost|Target] [water|Possession] [as the the temperature increased|Explanation].</ex>
<ex>[Gaining|Target] [leadership experience|Possession] is one of the benefits of being a camp counselor. [CNI|Owner]</ex>

The frame represents the result state of the #Entity after an event represented by the Undergo_change frame.

<ex>The original , [unaltered|Target] [version|Entity] of the story had been used initially as a sample exercise.</ex>

A #Defendant is officially summoned to appear in #Court by an #Authority (such as the police) based on certain #Charges. Alternatively, there is often an option for the #Defendant to pay a #Fine (thereby admitting their guilt) instead of going to #Court.

<ex>[The police|Auth] had [summonsed|Target] [the wrong man|Dfnd]. [DNI|Chrg]</ex>

<ex>[Since 1989|Tim] nearly a million [summonses|Target] have been issued [to people|Dfnd] [for not paying their water bills|Chrg]. [CNI|Auth]</ex>

<ex>[The officer|Auth] [cited|Target] [him|Dfnd] [for riding a bike without a light|Chrg].</ex>

Three related frames are Notification_of_charges, Entering_of_plea, and Fining.
This frame is distinguished from Notification_of_charges in that it typically deals with less serious #Charges and/or offenses. It also involves more than just notifying the #Defendant (Accused in the Notification_of_charges frame) of the #Charges being brought against them; LUs in the Citing frame also require that the #Defendant take some form of action (go to #Court or pay a #Fine). Similarly, Citing differs from Entering_of_plea because its scenario encompasses more than the latter; Citing involves steps both before and after the #Defendant enters a Plea in answer to #Charges. Finally, this frame differs from Fining since the #Defendant (Payer in the Fining frame) does not necessarily end up paying a #Fine. He or she may go to #Court instead.

A #Claimant asserts his or her right to possession of a piece of #Property (either real, such as land, or private).  The Claimant may be acting on the behalf of a #Beneficiary.
<ex>[The King|Claimant] [claims|Target] [this land and surrounding waters|Property].</ex>
<ex>Hoping to strike it rich, Thaddeus Gulch staked [his|Claimant] [claim|Target] by the river bed.</ex>
<ex>[I|Claimant] <supp>have</supp> [dibs|Target] [on the last piece of cake|Property].</ex>

Two or more individuals have a relationship by virtue of belonging to the same organization or institution. They may or may not be personally acquainted, and may or may not have chosen to have the relationship.

A person, the #Cognizer, thinks about a #Topic over a period of time. What is thought about may be a course of action that the person might take, or something more general.

<ex>[The men|Cognizer] were [silently|Manner] [mulling|Target] [over|Target] [the proposition of committing an assassination|Topic]</ex>

A concept, #Concept_1, is related causally or collocationally to another concept, #Concept_2 by means of some evidence. Words expressing small quantities or degrees (e.g., ""a tad"", ""a little"", etc.) can be used in a very similar function to words of this frame.  However, these words do not simply signify hesitation, but merely frequently imply it when used to modify a predication.  Such words can only be used on their on or with a noun to signify a small quantity or number (""a little whiskey"", see Proportional_quantity), or with an adjective to indicate that the quality described by the adjective is close to average (""a mite stupid"", ""somewhat confused"" see Degree).  Words of those frames may be nested within noun phrases or in other positions where content is not asserted but rather presupposed.  Words that belong to the Hedging frame, by contrast, either take a noun complement and indicate hesitancy or imprecision concerning the category (""something of a klutz""), or modify an entire proposition to indicate imprecision of the proposition (""I, like, waved it around""). There are several productive metaphors covered by this frame. The first and most common is one in which social influence or control is conceptualized as the physical exertion of force. The social influence/control is more specifically a propensity to cause change in social realms such as the economic, political, militaristic, cultural, or intimate:
<ex>There were theoretical limits to the [power|Target] [of the king|Exer].</ex>
<ex>Voters in the South have a [strong|Target] [incentive|Exer] to keep such Democrats in office.</ex>

Another similar metaphor is one in which psychological influence or control is understood as the physical exertion of force. The psychological influence/control includes the emotional as well:
<ex>[Poetic words in a text|Exer] can be <m>given</m> [more|Deg] [emotive|Dom] [power|Target] by using melisma.</ex>
<ex>He was a [forceful|Target] [speaker|Exer].</ex>

A third metaphor involves the amount of an entity construed as the physical force exertion of said entity. Depending on context, amount could be volume, etc. (STRONGEST critics; MIGHTY uproar).

Two related physical force dynamic frames are Level_of_force_resistance and Dynamism.
This frame is distinguished from the Level_of_force_resistance frame in that it describes the level of force <m>exertion</m> instead of the level of <m>resistance</m>, and also in that there are three categories of core FE available to the target (i.e #Exerter, #Action, or #Force), whereas in Level_of_force_resistance there are only two core FEs (i.e. Resisting_entity and Opposing_force). Of the latter frame's FEs, Opposing_force specifies the thing that the main entity resists to a level desginated by the target. Its parallel in Level_of_force_exertion is implied but backgrounded to the extent that it rarely appears as explicit lexical material; thus there is no corresponding core FE.

This frame differs from Dynamism with regard to individual-level cases; targets here express the FE's <m>capability</m>. In contrast, Dynamism targets express the FE's <m>tendency</m>. For example, ""a STRONG person"" is generally construed as a person who is <m>capable</m> of strength, while ""an ENERGETIC person"" (energetic.a from the Dynamism frame) is construed as a person who <m>tends</m> to be energetic.

However, there is overlap between the two frames in stage-level cases - ""a STRONG push"" and ""an ENERGETIC push"" seem rather comparable.

When the [Mitigating_situation|MS] clause involves a negation, like in the first example above, the non-negated form is generally taken to be the worse situation - potentially also in combination with previous discourse context. (i.e. Perhaps there's been a blizzard.  The better situation is that a blizzard did not occur.  The mitigating situation is that a blizzard occurred, but I don't have to go to school.  The worse situation would be that a blizzard occurred, and I also have to go to school.)

<ex>[It|tra]'s a trap!</ex>

A #Cause triggers a #System to operate in accordance with its intended purpose. Alternatively, an #Actor (acting volitionally or not) which participates in the #Cause, stands in for the #Cause. The #System often has the capability to detect and signal the presence of an object or the occurence of an event (metal, an earthquake). It may also be or contain an explosive device. The Means by which the Cause activates the System may also be specified.

<ex>[Smoking a cigarette|Cause] will normally not [set off|Target] [a smoke alarm|System].</ex>

<ex>[Suspected drug traffickers|Actor] [set off|Target] [12 bombs|System], injuring 35 people.</ex>

<ex>[Joseph|Actor] wriggled out of the ropes and inadvertantly [triggered|Target] [the burglar alarm|System].</ex>

A #State_of_affairs turns out to be true in someone's knowledge of the world. This may be recognized with evidence or in certain circumstances. The cognizer whose beliefs are affected is not expressed.

<ex>[Hybrid grass|State_of_affairs] may [prove|Target] [to be a valuable fuel source|State_of_affairs].</ex>

This frame has to do with nouns denoting types of entities. The #Subtype refers to a collection of members of a more general #Category which have certain defining characteristics; alternatively, the #Subtype refers only to the type itself, i.e. a more restrictive set of characteristics than those of the more general #Category.  The properties of the items that are included in the collection may be specified by the #Item_property.  Sometimes the #Subtypes themselves are described by some #Type_property.

<ex>I don't like this [newfangled|Type_property] [[kind|Subtype]|Target] [of  fish|Category].</ex>
<ex>Kleo isn't [our|Item_property] [[sort|Subtype]|Target] [of people|Category].</ex> <ex>He argued against the [formalist|Item_property] [[type|Subtype]|Target] [of analysis of art|Category].</ex>
<ex>I think that she was referring to the other [[type|Subtype]|Target]. [DNI|Category]</ex>

A #Reported_fact is presented by the speaker as deriving from statements (made directly to them or to others) of third parties.

<ex>Four [purported|Target] [gang members|rep] could face death penalty in Virginia slaying of federal informant.</ex>

A #Wearer removes an item of #Clothing from a #Body_location (the part of the body that the #Clothing is prototypically worn on.)

<ex>Walking on sand is better if [you|wea] [take|Target] [off|Target] [your shoes|clo]. [INI|bod]</ex>
A #Driver transports themselves and possibly other passengers (the #Theme) to another location.

An #Agent has access to a finite amount of some #Resource and uses it in some way to complete a #Purpose. The specific #Portion of the #Resource may be stated, and after the #Resource is spent, it is no longer available to the #Agent. The #Means by which the #Resource is used may be mentioned, but it is often implied by the stated Purpose or understood based on what the #Resource is.

<ex>[I|Agent] [used|Target] [half|Portion] [of the bag of dirt|Resource] [to plant the roses|Purpose].</ex>
<ex>[She|Agent] just [spends|Target] [all her time|Resource] [sitting in front of the television|Purpose].</ex>

A #Vehicle moves into position or otherwise changes configuration or state as preparation for normal operation. The focus of the event is on the state of the #Vehicle rather than any agent which is manipulating the #Vehicle.

<ex>[The flight for New York|Vehicle] [finally|Time] [lifted off|Target] [from Oakland International|Source] [with one hundred passengers aboard|Depictive].</ex>

An entity goes through several versions, from initial to final.

<ex>This is my [first|Target] [draft|Item].</ex>

A #Protagonist delays a planned action because they cannot or do not want to proceed until an #Expected_event occurs. The #Expected_event may be evoked by reference to a #Salient_entity that participates in it.  If a #Salient_entity is expressed, the #Expected_event is typically the arrival of the #Salient_entity at the #Place where the #Protagonist is located.

<ex>[The cat|pro] [waited|Target] [on top of the washer|pla] [as Elmer popped the lid off the can of cat food|Time] and then pounded the can's contents onto the plate</ex>

<ex>The family was furious that [their 84-year-old dad|pro] had to [wait|Target] [52 hours|dur] [in the emergency room|pla].</ex>

Although in both frames a Protagonist/Agent is not performing some desired action for some period of time, the use of wait.v in this frame is different from that in Holding_off_on in that Waiting prominently portrays a future event that will allow the Protagonist to proceed (with doing something), whereas Holding_off_on does not necessarily imply that there is some event or state-of-affairs that will allow the Agent to proceed, rather focussing on the action that the Agent is not yet taking.
A #Suspect has been investigated and has a warrant issued for his or her arrest on certain #Charges. <ex> [Bill|Suspect] <m>is</m> [wanted|Target] [on murder charges|Charges]. </ex>

A #Cognizer faces a choice on some #Issue. They have several #Options  available but keep changing their mind between #Option_1 and #Option_2. The #Cognizer may in fact act on their choice at some point but they need not; the #Options can simply be considered for some time with one being favored for a while and then the other.

<ex>[Dave Hayes|Cognizer] [wavered|Target] [about moving to California|Issue] [because so many of his friends are in Baltimore|Explanation].</ex>

<ex>[He|Cognizer] had [wavered|Target] [between half a dozen places|Options]; it was pure chance that he had chosen Marvis Bay.</ex>

<ex>In any event, [I|Cognizer] [still|Time] [go back and forth|Target] [on what I want to do|Issue]. </ex>

<ex>[He|Cognizer] was firm in his beliefs, [never|Time] [waffled|Target] [from one platform|Option_1] [to another|Option_2] and was always harshly clear in his stance.</ex>

<ex>[Upper management|Cognizer] [waffled|Target] [whether Fletcher fit their salary structure|Issue].</ex>

The words in this frame refer to what #Clothing the #Wearer (or a specific #Body_part of the #Wearer) has on.

<ex>[I|Wearer] [had|Target] [on|Target] [the most ridiculous monkey-suit you could imagine|Clothing].</ex>
<ex>[These two losers|Wearer] were [wearing|Target] [bras|Clothing] [on their heads|BP]!</ex>

Many targets incorporate the #Clothing item, and some targets describe the state of <ment>not</ment> wearing something (when it might be expected).

<ex>Do you think anyone would notice if [I|Wearer] <ment>went</ment> [topless|Target]?</ex>

NB: There is a very common metonymy in which characteristics of the clothing stand for the clothing itself, such as

<ex>the [man|Wearer] [clad|Target] [in leather|Clothing].</ex>
<ex>[She|Wearer] was [dressed|Target] [all in red|Clothing].</ex>

Such sentences should be tagged METAPHOR on the sentence level.

Ambient conditions of temperature, precipitation, windiness, and sunniness pertain at a certain #Place and #Time.  Further #Specification of the conditions that pertain may also be indicated.
<ex><x>A [blustery|Specification] [storm|Target]</x> <gov>blew</gov> <gov>in</gov>.</ex>
<ex><m>There</m> <m>was</m> a [thick|Spec] [blizzard|Target] [last night|Time].</ex>
<ex><x>An armada of [hailstorms|Target]</x> <gov>swept</gov> through the region.</ex>

A #Cognizer would engage in an #Activity if asked or otherwise prompted to do so.

<ex>[The court|Cognizer] <m>is</m> [willing|Target] [to depart from the usual range of sentencing|Activity] .</ex>

<ex>[The Nicaraguan National Assembly|Cognizer] has <m>been</m> [reluctant|Target] [to destroy the remaining stockpile|Activity]. </ex>

<ex>The Turks are in [grudging|Target] [acceptance|act] of terms set by EU.</ex>

<ex>Would [you|Cognizer] <m>be</m> [prepared|Target][to give up some of your privacy to industry to help improve customer service|Activity]?</ex>

An individual that is scheduled to be a #Participant, or already is a #Participant in an #Activity or an #Organization, indicates that  they will no not or no longer participate in that #Activity or #Organization. Note that the #Organization often is one that is constituted by a treaty or agreement.

<ex>[The Moslem contingent|Participant] had [withdrawn|Target] [from the EC talks|Activity] [on May 27|Time].</ex>

<ex>[The right-wing nationalist Tsomet Party|Participant] formally [withdrew|Target] [from the ruling coalition|Organization].</ex>

One linguistic unit, #Sign_1, has a relation to another linguistic unit, #Sign_2. This relation may be semantic, phonological, orthographic, or distributional in nature. The parameter along which the two signs are set in relation to each other is incorporated in the meaning of the target words in this frame. When the relation is symmetrical, the two linguistic units can be expressed jointly, #Signs. Otherwise they have to be expressed disjointly. Ordinarily it is assumed that one linguistic unit has exactly one meaning but in cases where this is not so, a set of #Circumstances may be specified that helps pick out the relevant sense.

<ex> [Happy and sad|Signs] are [antonyms|Target].</ex>
<ex>[In one sense|Circumstances], [dog|Sign_1] is a [hyponym|Target] of [itself|Sign_2].</ex>
